channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Three 30 cm potholes on Cherry Avenue, 28th December
item.description:
A line of three potholes that have been getting steadily bigger over a period of two to three months. There is also some deep cracks emerging.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Ravensgate Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20 cm pothole at end of the driveway of 23 Ravensgate Road, 28th December
item.description:
Middle of the road outside 23 Ravensgate Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Ravensgate Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 28th December
item.description:
24/12/23 email rcvd - On the A435 at Gotherington Cross (What 3 words: allergy.withdrew.calculate) there are bollards in the middle of the road either side of the junction. I assume they are meant to be reflective but they are filthy dirty and you can’t seem them until the last minute at night, especially on dipped headlights. This is a nasty car smash waiting to happen when some fast driver decides to overtake. They have been like this for a few weeks now. Please action this with urgency. Regards
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Second keep left sign now demolished, 28th December
item.description:
The temporary keep left a board sign was stood back up, but because it was damaged previously, it was only stood up on three out of four legs. The sign fell over within 24 hours. Not a great fix. Two days ago the remaining keep left sign was driven over, over the top of the temporary keep left board sign that had fallen back down. Now there are no keep left signs and people are driving into the holes in the island.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whittington Court Lane, Whittington, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 28th December
item.description:
email rec 21/12/2023 - I would draw your attention to a very old and overly large plane tree on corner of Bayshill and Fauconberg roads in Cheltenham. Recently old rotten branches have been falling down onto the road, street and adjacent garden of Summerfield House, 21 Royal Parade. Some of these branches have been stacked next to it, while others recycled. Before passing children at nearby Ladies College or other pedestrians are hurt or cars damaged, you may wish to inspect the tree to cut back the rotten branches or see if it is coming to the end of its natural life.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud/leaves/debris on road at corner, 28th December
item.description:
The mud/leaves have washed down Noverton lane and is now very thick at the bend in the road outside 58 Noverton lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Noverton Lane, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees, 28th December
item.description:
2 trees on Boverton drive Brockworth are losing branches during most storms and need to be checked for decay or pruned to remove dead branches as the ones that are falling are getting bigger after each storm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77,79, Boverton Drive, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water bubbling up through edge of manhole cover indicating blocked drain, 28th December
item.description:
The manhole cover is set into the bank outside St Martin’s Church Woolstone and water bubbles up in the gap between the edge of the manhole cover and the concrete surround. There is then a stream running down the road which now persists even after the rain has stopped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light has not been working for around 3 weeks and it is very dark, 28th December
item.description:
It is along half way along the alley leading from Blacksmith Lane to Brookfield Road. FP number CHURCHDOWN FOOTPATH 49 Number : ECN49 It has the a sticker with the number 2 on it. It is very dark for anyone to safely use it in the evenings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmith Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Culvert under road exploded, 28th December
item.description:
Culvert under Corndean Lane has collapsed/broken, huge amounts of water running down Corndean Lane. I cleaned/swept all the clay and stones out of road this morning but it's dangerous to people walking up lane and there is a deep hole where the culvert has collapsed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corndean Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight completely obscured by enormous hedge. Dangerous for cyclists and motorists as cannot see edge of road or even most of the left-hand carriageway in the dark, 28th December
item.description:
As you go down Moorend Rd, towards the park on the left and up to the junction with the A435. It is just before the park entrance on the left as the road dips down into the hollow. The hedge is now something like 25ft high, basically as high as the lamppost it's obscuring and all the other lampposts are going to be obscured as well. Please, as a matter of urgency due to the danger posed, would you get the owner of the property to cut the hedge right back all along its length, not just around that one lamppost otherwise you'll be coming back to do the job again and again. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 28th December
item.description:
Perm lights out one way, customer was waiting for 10minutes and went through the lights, unsure if they were working the other ends but customer is concerned that there is cameras on them and wanted to let us know they are faulty.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles
